plots: Jaheira kept the player waiting as there were things she had to take care of
Jaheira was asked to bring the player to the Harper Hold

quest.title: Summoned to the Harper Hold
quest.objective: see the Harpers with Jaheira
quest.description:
Hail there! I said I would return, and I have. Sorry to have kept you waiting, but there were things I had to take care of. Now that we have met once again, there is something I must ask of you.
We must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I have been asked to bring you, and we must go soon. They will allow us to pass the wards of the door, but I must be with you.

TESS55: a male wood elf who is Delphine's trusty contact inside the Thalmor Embassy

plots: Elenwen regularly throws parties: while the player is talking with Malborn, Delphine gets the player an invitation to one of Elenwen's parties

quest.title: Diplomatic Immunity
quest.objective: infiltrate the party at the Thalmor Embassy, and find Elenwen's secret files
tasks: infiltrate the party at the Thalmor Embassy, and find Elenwen's secret files
quest.description:
The Thalmor ambassador, Elenwen, regularly throws parties where the rich and connected cozy up to the Thalmor.
I can get you into one of those parties. Once you're inside the Embassy, you get away and find Elenwen's secret files. I have a contact inside the Embassy. He's not up for this kind of high-risk mission, but he can help you. His name's Malborn. Wood elf, plenty of reason to hate the Thalmor. You can trust him.
I'll get word for him to meet you in Solitude, at the Winking Skeever -- you know it? While you're doing that, I'll work on getting you an invitation to Elenwen's little party.
Meet me at the Solitude stables after you've arranged things with Malborn.

plots: slaughterfish nearly took off Aelwin Merowald's leg
Aelwin Merowald could retire with the money he would get from the slaughterfish scales

quest.title: Go Fish
quest.objective: bring 12 slaughterfish scales to Aelwin Merowald
tasks: kill slaughterfish and collect their scales
bring 12 slaughterfish scales to Aelwin Merowald
quest.description:
You know, stranger, there comes a time in every man's life when he has to admit that he's lost the fight.
Well, I've fought and I've lost. Who did I lose to? Who is my great enemy? Well, don't laugh... it's a bunch of damn fish.
I'm a fisherman. Or at least, I was. Until one of those slaughterfish damn near took my leg off. I was collecting their scales, see. I had a contract with this young alchemist. You wouldn't believe what he was paying for those scales! Then last month, one of the bastards got ahold of my leg. Took me right out of the business. But this alchemist, he needs the scales right away. The alchemist was paying so much for the scales that I'm close to having enough saved so that I can retire. But now, I can't get out there to Lake Rumare -- not with this leg. I only needed twelve more scales! Can you believe it? I was so close!
I've picked up a few things in my travels. If you head out there and bring me back the twelve scales that I need, I can make it worth your time. Help an old fisherman out, won't you?

TESO175: the son of the guildleader of the Fighters Guild

plots: Modryn Oreyn sent Viranus Donton and some other Fighters Guild members on a troll killing mission to Forsaken Mine: Modryn Oreyn felt that they were up to the task

quest.title: Trolls of Forsaken Mine
quest.objective: find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
tasks: find Viranus Donton and other Fighters Guild members who went missing
find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
quest.description:
I have got another job for you. It's a sensitive one. I need you to find Viranus Donton.
I sent him on a mission to Forsaken Mine. He and some others were supposed to clear the place of trolls. Haven't heard back from them in days. I want you to go check it out. I don't need to tell you how sensitive a matter this is.
We'd been contracted to clear the place of trolls. It was a tough job, but I felt the men I sent were up to it. I want to know what happened.
Get moving, and report back to me as soon as possible.

TESO28: Ursanne's missing husband who developed a gambling addiction

plots: Aleron Loche wasted Ursanne and his hard earned money on bets: Aleron Loche wanted to move him and Ursanne to the Imperial City
Aleron Loche borrowed money from Kurdan gro-Dragol: Aleron Loche owes Kurdan gro-Dragol 500 gold
Aleron Loche did not return home after meeting Kurdan gro-Dragol at the Lonely Suitor Lodge yesterday

quest.title: Caught in the Hunt
quest.objective: find Aleron Loche
quest.description:
I'm Ursanne. I'm sorry to impose upon you like this, but I'm in need of assistance, and I don't know what to do. My husband, Aleron, is missing.
It all started when Aleron became foolish, and started gambling. He'd visit the arena every week and spend our hard earned money on bets. I told him to stop, but he didn't listen. He was certain he could win us a fortune and move us somewhere nicer, like the Imperial City. It didn't take long for Aleron to begin losing. He resorted to borrowing money from a usurer to cover his losses and place new bets. As you can imagine, it didn't pay off. He ended up owing around 500 gold. We could never have that kind of money to pay back the usurer.
Yesterday, the usurer, Kurdan gro-Dragol, sent for my husband to meet him at the Lonely Suitor Lodge. He hasn't returned since. I fear for his life. Kurdan isn't known for his patience. Please, I'm not wealthy, but I'd give anything to see Aleron again. Please, find Aleron.
Farewell, and be careful, Kurdan is not to be trusted.

TESO385: the mistress of shadows, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the Eye was stolen from its shrine and hid in dark waters

quest.title: Nocturnal's Missing Eye
quest.objective: bring Nocturnal's Eye back to Nocturnal
tasks: bring Nocturnal's Eye back to Nocturnal
quest.description:
Night among strangers. Secrets in the dark. Nocturnal is here.
But my Eye is blind and drowned, stolen from its shrine, and hid in dark waters. To steal from a god is most unwise. In Leyawiin, two Argonians think themselves secret, but the Eye has seen them.
Find these thieves in the city that spans the waters. Learn where they hide my Eye. Retrieve the Eye of Nocturnal, mortal, and return it to me, and I shall look favorably upon you.
You, mortal, may take this Skeleton Key upon your return. It shall open the secrets of dark places for you.

plots: Flydian was sent by the High Merchant
druids are suspected of the animal attacks

quest.title: Animal trouble in Trademeet
quest.objective: investigate why forest animals are attacking Trademeet
tasks: go talk with the High Merchant
investigate why forest animals are attacking Trademeet
quest.description:
I am Flydian, a messenger sent by the High Merchant of Trademeet to find someone to help our town.
Trademeet is under attack by forest animals. The High Merchant thinks druids may be responsible, but we haven't the manpower to find them and stop it.
The High Merchant will have more information for you.

plots: Olivia wants reputation
Olivia gives the player seeds that can be used to tame a parrot

quest.title: A Talkative Pet
quest.objective: bring a tamed parrot to Olivia
tasks: bring a tamed parrot to Olivia
quest.description:
My mommy and daddy say that I can't go outside the village. I don't! But I really wanna have a parrot. The other kids would certainly like me better if I had a cool pet like a parrot!
You a big enough to travel to places on your own without your parents. Traveler, please tame a parrot and bring it to me. I even have some seeds for you: tame the parrot with them. Parrots live in jungles.
I will give you this diamond I once found on the ground. Even a kid like me knows that those are valuable.

TESO315: a man , and the last known descendant of Springheel Jak
TESO237: a stone that reveals secrets to its fielder

plots: the Gray Fox has used Savilla's Stone, again, to find out that he needs another special item, the boots of Springheel Jak, to move forward with his plans
the Earl of Imbel is the last known descendant of Springheel Jak

quest.title: Boots of Springheel Jak
quest.objective: find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
tasks: search for clues in the Earl of Imbel's house
find out where Springheel Jak is buried, and retrieve his boots for the Gray Fox
quest.description:
Further use of Savilla's Stone has revealed that I need another special item to move forward with my plans. I need the boots of Springheel Jak. He is a famous thief that died some 300 years ago. Legend has it that he was buried with his boots on.
Find out where Springheel Jak is buried and bring me back those boots. Will you do this for me? It pays well.
The Earl of Imbel is the only descendant of Springheel Jak's line that I have been able to locate. His name is Jakben, and he lives somewhere in the Imperial City. There might be a clue in the Earl's house.

BG1183: an elven mage who was a guide to Balduran

plots: Dradeel converted to the Church of Selûne recently
there are werewolves everywhere
Dradeel might find a way out of this island if his spellbook was returned to him

quest.title: Returning Dradeel's Spellbook
quest.objective: destroy the lycanthropes' lair, and bring Dradeel's spellbook back to its owner
tasks: find the lycanthropes' lair and Dradeel's spellbook within it
destroy the lycanthropes' lair, and bring Dradeel's spellbook back to its owner
quest.description:
I am Dradeel, mage and recent convert to the Church of Selûne.
I was the guide for Balduran's brave adventures to the ends of the world and beyond. The wolf-men are everywhere. The lycanthropes' lair is in Balduran's ship. My spellbook lies within. With it, I am a powerful mage. Without it, I am the pauper that stands before you. With my spellbook retrieved, I may be able to discover a way off of the island.
If you go to destroy the lycanthropes' lair, I would ask that you find my book.

plots: Malene has seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the entrance to Moss Rock Cavern

quest.title: The Gravefinder's Repose
quest.objective: help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
tasks: help Malene deal with Raelynn the Gravefinder
quest.description:
Thank goodness someone that can help is here! I don't know how to make this request any simpler, but to put it bluntly, Raelynn the Gravefinder must die.
A few months ago, that witch of a Necromancer decided to inhabit Moss Rock Cavern just north of my inn. I don't know what she does in there; frankly, I don't want to know. However, I do know that after she arrived, the woods at night became unsafe.
I've seen undead of all types walking in the dark woods near the cave entrance. Now, this area's getting a bad reputation and my business has waned. Every day, it seems the number of undead increase.
If someone can get into the cave and kill Raelynn, maybe we can stem the tide. Her death pays a handsome bounty. I hope you'll take advantage of the opportunity. Raelynn will finally get what's coming to her.

TESO484: a camp on the shore of Niben Bay
TESO485: a harmless, sad ghost of a sailor

plots: the player asked Gilgondorin about the Watchman
Gilgondorin pinpoints where the Watchman appears on the player's map

quest.title: The Forlorn Watchman
quest.objective: lay the Watchman to rest
tasks: go see the Watchman at 8 o'clock at night
quest.description:
So you want to learn more about the ghostly Watchman?
The Watchman looks like he may have been a sailor. No one knows where he came from, or why he looks so sad. I don't like talking about the dead like they're some kind of tourist attraction, but that spirit has been making his ghostly journey for years now. We've learned to just accept that he's there.
Every night, sure as clockwork, he appears at Bawnwatch Camp at 8 on the shore of Niben Bay. He's never harmed anyone, but most people give him a wide berth. You seem curious enough, so I'll be glad to pinpoint where he appears on your map.

MC156: a sunken ship east of Seaside Settlement
MC159: a sunken ship east of Seaside Settlement
a sunken ship east of Seaside Settlement

plots: Kitt wants serenity
the player a friend of Kitt
Kitt gives the player a potion of water breathing

quest.title: A Bringer of Hope
quest.objective: recover a bundle of potion ingredients for Kitt
tasks: find the bundle of potion ingredients
recover a bundle of potion ingredients for Kitt
quest.description:
The ship sank. All those poor sailors have now passed the veil to the other side. This is a sad day for us all.
My friend, that ship carried important potion ingredient for our village. Most of the goods that are not produced here are transported here by the sea. Now I can't fashion remedies for our villagers, and the next shipment will not be here for a long time.
You are a good person. I ask you to find a bundle of life-saving potion ingredients for me. That would mean a lot for the whole village! The bundle should be in the sunken ship east of here. Here, this potion of water breathing should help you dive to the ship save and sound.
I'll even let you have my old, extra brewing stand as a gift upon your return. Be careful while you dive; there a many lethal things lurking beneath the waves. I'd hate to bury a friend.

TESS80: the nobleman who rules over Markarth
TESS85: a powerful artifact that was held at the College of Winterhold
TESS86: a powerful staff that can contain energy from the Eye of Magnus

plots: the player is the Arch-Mage
the player should have the Staff of Magnus

quest.title: Aftershock
quest.objective: take care of a magical disturbance
tasks: contain the power from the Eye of Magnus with the Staff of Magnus
take care of a magical disturbance
quest.description:
There is something you should be aware of, Arch-Mage. We've been contacted by the Jarl of Markarth. It would seem there's some sort of disturbance.
From what few details we were given, it sounds quite familiar. I suspect that the power released by the Eye of Magnus was not fully contained, and has coalesced in this part of Skyrim. I do hope you still have the Staff of Magnus someplace. I suspect you're going to need it to contain the power.
I'm sure the Jarl will be quite pleased to. I think it only fitting that the Arch-Mage personally receive a large portion of the reward.

plots: the player has worked for Bodhi before
Aran Linvail is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house: the player needs a key to the basement
Tizzak is missing, and the Shadow Thieves may have him: he may know how to access Aran Linvail's sanctum

quest.title: To Kill a Guild
quest.objective: kill Aran Linvail
tasks: find a way to access Aran Linvail's sanctum
quest.description:
Again, I require your talents. Now to the task at hand.
It is time to take down the leadership of the Shadow Thieves and throw them into a more permanent disarray from which they may not recover. You must invade their lair one last time. You must kill Aran Linvail, the Shadowmaster. Do this for me, and our arrangement will be fulfilled.
Aran is in the basement of the Shadow Thief guild house, so you need a key. The lock is likely unpickable. What good is a lock in a thieves' guild if any thief can pick it?
One more thing: Tizzak, an employee of mine, is missing, and the Thieves may have him. Find him, and he may tell you how to access Aran's sanctum. Go now!

plots: Mickey wants knowledge

quest.title: Uncharted Waters
quest.objective: bring 6 tropical fish to Mickey
quest.description:
I've caught a mountain of salmon and cod. Yet, there are still some more exotic fish that have eluded my fishing rod.
Traveler, do you like fishing? May I ask you to catch 6 tropical fish for me? These sort of fish are common in vast oceans of our world. I yearn to take a look at new kinds of fish. I could even try to breed them.
If you happen to give me 6 exotic fish, I'll be glad to reward you with an enchanted fishing rod of mine. A best kind of tool for a passionate fisher.

MC66: mushroom fields, and dimly lit places
MC67: mushroom fields, and dimly lit places
mushroom fields, and dimly lit places

plots: Ilona wants comfort
Ilona gives the player a bowl for making the mushroom stew

quest.title: Not like My Momma Makes It
quest.objective: give mushroom stew to Ilona
tasks: find a red mushroom, and a brown mushroom
quest.description:
My momma is allergic to mushrooms. I can't ever get delicious mushroom stew at home.
Here, take my bowl. Find one red mushroom, and another brown mushroom. Make mushroom stew in my bowl. Then, give the stew to me. Other kids say that mushrooms grow in fields, and poorly lit areas.
I loaned my momma's roses a bit. You can have the whole ten of them. I'm sure that she won't notice 'em missing.

BG234: the player's tutor in the player's duties to Lathander

plots: the player is a cleric of Lathander, and one of Lathander's favored
Lara will send the player someone who needs the guidance of Lathander

quest.title: Guide the Followers of Lathander
quest.objective: lend your wisdom to the believers of Lathander
tasks: give guidance to someone that needs the guidance of Lathander
lend your wisdom to the believers of Lathander
quest.description:
Hello there, I am Lara, and I shall be your tutor.
Not that you need schooling, but you might be unfamiliar with the duties you are to perform.
In exchange for the many benefits you will enjoy as a favored of Lathander, you will have a few tasks to perform while here. They are humble, but very important.
You are to lend your wisdom to the wounded and afflicted, those that are suffering from a misdirection of the heart. Guide them in the light of the Morninglord's glory.
We shall introduce you slowly to the work. I shall send you someone that needs the guidance of Lathander, and then we shall evaluate how you have done.

TESS417: a paranoid man who hates the Empire
TESS420: a province of the Empire that might break out of the Empire
TESS421: the capital city of Skyrim, under Imperial rule

plots: Dengeir of Stuhn thinks that Lod wrote a letter to General Tullius

quest.title: Imperial Spy?
quest.objective: give Lod's letter to Dengeir of Stuhn
tasks: give Lod's letter to Dengeir of Stuhn
quest.description:
There's a plot. Not against me. Against all of Falkreath. Those Imperial bastards are spying on every one of us.
Last night I saw Lod the blacksmith writing a letter. Probably sending word to Solitude and General Tullius. Are you loyal to Skyrim? Break into Lod's house and get that letter.
The Empire is probably making Lod smith up more swords and armor for them.

TESO124: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood
TESO126: a large manor house in Skingrad

plots: the guests falsely believe that they cannot leave Summitmist Manor before finding a chest containing gold and the key to Summitmist Manor
the door to Summitmist Manor will be locked behind the player until the other guests are dead: the doorman will explain the rest

quest.title: Whodunit?
quest.objective: assassinate the other five guests at the party
tasks: assassinate the other five guests at the party
quest.description:
Do you like parties? Because you've been invited to one. Of course you'll be killing all the other guests. Each guest, at some point in the past, wronged their mysterious host. Now he's hired us to exact his revenge. Are you ready to attend?
You need to go to the city of Skingrad, to the large house known as Summitmist Manor. There you will meet up with five very unlucky guests. In order to receive your bonus, you must kill each guest secretly, one by one. If anyone sees you committing murder, the bonus is forfeit. The guests believe there is a chest of gold hidden in the house, and have agreed to be locked inside until one of them finds it. In fact, the guests believe the key to the manor is inside the chest, and only by satisfying their greed will they be allowed to leave. Poor fools. There is, of course, no chest of gold. The guests will find no key. After you arrive, the doors will be locked behind you, as everyone expects. When all the guests lie dead, you will be free to leave.
Now go, see the doorman at Summitmist Manor. He will explain the rest. Have fun.

TESS532: a repenting mage who has never killed an innocent person
TESS533: a tower filled with witches and Hagravens, and Illia's former home

plots: Illia just killed a female witch in front of the player
Illia and the witch were supposed to find a human sacrifice: the witch attacked Illia because Illia could not do it

quest.title: Repentance
quest.objective: help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
tasks: follow Illia to the top of the tower
help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
quest.description:
By the gods! I know this looks bad. Let me explain...
I called Darklight Tower home, now I know that was a mistake. I am, or was part of a coven serving the Hagravens that live there. So was she.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill. We needed a sacrifice for the Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things, Hagravens. I can't be a part of that. Gods, I can't run away from this.
I'm going up there to stop her. This cycle must end. I don't know what brought you here, but I could use your help, if you're willing. Follow me. We have to fight our way up the Tower. I don't think anyone else here is about to have a change of heart.

plots: Firebead Elvenhair left his identify scroll to Tethtoril

quest.title: Firebead's Scroll
quest.objective: bring Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll to him
tasks: get Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll from Tethtoril
bring Firebead Elvenhair's identify scroll to him
quest.description:
I, Firebead Elvenhair, have a small errand for you.
I left an identify scroll with Tethtoril, in the inner grounds. He should be done examining it by now, so if you could fetch it for me, I'd be grateful. I have a great use for those types of scrolls.
Allow me to cast a little spell on you as a reward. It will protect you from any evil you might meet tonight.

TL25: a worried wife, and a passionate animal owner
TL27: a cave inhabited by nasty creatures

plots: Bellethe and Finnas are homesteaders with a small farm in the Frosted Hills: they went to get supplies from Estherian Enclave before winter

quest.title: Little Lost Ones
quest.objective: help Bellethe find Finnas and their precious animals
tasks: help Bellethe find Finnas and their precious animals
quest.description:
Please, help me! Our dear little ones wandered into that cave! My husband Finnas ventured after them, but it is crawling with nasty creatures, and he hasn't returned!
My husband Finnas and I were on our way to the Estherian Enclave. We're homesteaders, with a small farm in the Frosted Hills. The weather is getting harsh, so we were making one last run for supplies before winter. Oh, I'm beside myself with worry! Please, find Finnas and our precious babies! You have to help us! You could have a special item as a token of our gratitude!

plots: the player told Taarie that the player is going to the Blue Palace

quest.title: Fit for a Jarl
quest.objective: promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
tasks: wear one of the Radiant Raiment's outfits, and speak to Elisif about it
promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
quest.description:
You're really going to the Blue Palace? That presents an opportunity.
If you were willing to wear one of Radiant Raiment's outfits and speak to the Jarl I would not only pay you but let you keep the outfit.
Here's the outfit. Try to get Jarl Elisif's opinion on it and if she likes it mention it's from Radiant Raiment.

TESS225: the god of life and death

plots: Tova is not handling the death of her and Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's daughter well

quest.title: A Comforting Amulet
quest.objective: bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
tasks: bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
quest.description:
Please forgive my mood. I'm still coming to terms with my daughter's death. Our little girl died recently. I've been shouldering my days with strong mead, but nothing gives my Tova peace.
I've been looking for an Amulet of Arkay to remind my wife that our child is with the gods now, but I can't find one. Would you be willing to give me an Amulet of Arkay, should you find one?
I hope Arkay grants my wife some comfort.

BG1197: a man who deserted the Flaming Fist

plots: Samuel is traveling with a woman

quest.title: Samuel the Deserter
quest.objective: capture Samuel
quest.description:
I am a proud member of the Flaming Fist. I've been searching for a deserter. His name is Samuel, and he should be traveling with a woman.
There is a bounty of 50 gold for his capture.

TESS130: a male bandit in the bandit leader's gang, hates Brodir
TESS131: a male bandit in the bandit leader's gang, hates Herd
TESS132: a journal written by the bandit leader

plots: the bandit leader thinks that his men are going to mutiny: Herd and Brodir are leading their own cliques within the bandits
the bandit leader is going to gather up gold and escape downriver to Dragon Bridge

quest.title: Robber's Stash
quest.objective: find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
tasks: go to the island to the south and find the old tree stump
find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
quest.description:
Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.

plots: the player is not an Orc or blood-kin to the Orcs: the player is not welcome at the Orc stronghold by the code of Malacath

quest.title: The Forgemaster's Fingers
quest.objective: bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
tasks: bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
quest.description:
Halt, outlander. By the Code of Malacath, this stronghold belongs to the Orcs. Your kind are unwelcome. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.
Hmm... there is a way to become Blood-Kin, if you truly insist on entering our stronghold. We've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse.
They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Find them at Stony Creek Cave. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs.

TL2109: a relieved Zeraphi master of explosives

plots: Hareph and his Zeraphi crew came to the outpost to deal with the Skara: the crew went to investigate the stacks and never came back
Hareph gives the player explosives

quest.title: Shadow of the Skara
quest.objective: help the Zeraphi any way you can
tasks: help the Zeraphi any way you can
quest.description:
I'm so relieved you have arrived! My crew and I journeyed to this outpost to deal with the increasingly aggressive Skara.
I remained here to fashion additional explosives while my crew investigated the stacks, but they never returned. I have been unable to leave here because of the swarming Skara.
Please take these explosives with you and journey to Swarm Point, and search for any surviving Zeraphi and help them in any way you can!

TESO243: a male thief, and Arnora Auria's ex-boyfriend

plots: Jorundr and Arnora Auria have had a rocky relationship: Jorundr and Arnora Auria committed petty crimes all over Cyrodiil
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets
Arnora Auria got afraid of Jorundr

Jorundr and Arnora Auria's last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City: Jorundr killed a guard and he was captured by the Bruma guard two days later at Jorundr and Arnora Auria's makeshift campsite
Jorundr had moved the stolen gold away from the campsite

quest.title: Two Sides of the Coin
quest.objective: find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
tasks: find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
quest.description:
Here's the deal. Jorundr and I have had a rocky relationship at best.
Against my will, I've been dragged all over Cyrodiil helping him commit petty crimes. I wouldn't say we're thieves. I mean, we've stolen things... sure. But we've never stolen that much at one time. Just enough to keep us going. That is, until last year.
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Not just lone merchants, mind you. I'm talking about the bigger scores. Like estates and tax shipments. I begged him to stop, as I knew that his capers would one day lead to violence. He just threatened to... hurt me if I got in his way. I think the gold changed him. I really do. He wasn't the man I met seven years ago. The few times I tried to say something, he'd strike me or push me away. I began to become frightened of him.
Our last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City. We robbed it, and in the midst of the chaos, Jorundr killed a guard. I was mortified. We snatched up the gold and holed up in the mountains. He said if I breathed a word of the murder to anyone, he'd kill me. I was terrified of him at this point. Two days later, the Bruma City Guard traced us to our makeshift campsite. I was off gathering food, but Jorundr was captured. Served him right. When I went back to the site later, the gold was gone! He'd moved it! What I need you to do is go to the Bruma Castle Dungeons and speak to him for me. Convince him to tell you where the gold is and then we split it.

TESO63: Duke of Mania, a Felldew addict
TESO344: a chalice that makes the world a much brighter and happier place after eating Felldew

plots: Thadon is inebriated from withdrawal effects of Felldew

quest.title: Addiction
quest.objective: return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
tasks: return the Chalice of Reversal to Thadon
quest.description:
Ahh yes, THERE you are! You couldn't imagine how long I, Thadon, the Duke of Mania, have been waiting for you. So little to do, and so much time. Hmm, could you, in fact, imagine just how long I've been waiting? I don't think you could, but I might be wrong.
It felt like rather a long time, but then long times get longer when you're standing around thinking about them. A curious thing, that. Long roads get longer too, if you're thinking about them, but what about long words? They don't change nearly as much. Long, short -- it all ends up the same. Dust and tears. Usually tears first, then the dust. Dust can't cry, you see. That would be... well, amusing. You know what's NOT amusing? I don't have my Chalice of Reversal. It makes me sad. When I get sad, I don't care to do much of anything. I certainly don't care to help people who show up on my doorstep wanting something. Are we getting the picture here?
The Chalice of Reversal is one of my favorite toys. Does wonders for creativity. Well, not by itself, but it helps. Is this making sense? Look, you eat the Felldew, then use the chalice, and find the world a much brighter and happier place. Honest. But I don't have it. So I can't eat Felldew, because that would just be bad. I mean, really bad. Find my chalice!

BG238: the player's old friend, and a strong warrior

plots: Coran and Safana were traveling Forest of Tethir: Safana was kidnapped by wolfweres

quest.description:
Hail, good friend! I am most pleased to see you here! Your timing could not be better, as I, Coran, am in most dire need!
I was traveling Forest of Tethir with my beloved Safana... and now she is kidnapped! It is dreadful! Two days ago, we were beset by giant wolves... wolfweres, I fear. They tried to take us both, but I was able to escape. Safana, however, was not so fortunate. I tracked them to an encampment east of here, but even a great warrior such as myself cannot beat them alone.
We must save her and strike a blow against the foul werebeasts! Together, we shall be unstoppable!

Something has taken control of most of the people of Solstheim. It makes them forget themselves, and work on these horrible creations that corrupt the Stones, the very land itself. My father Storn, our shaman, says Miraak has returned to Solstheim, but that is impossible.
If you want to know what lies beneath the Temple of Miraak, then let us go together. First, we need to find a way into the Temple of Miraak.

The High Fane dates from the Late Ayleid Period, following the fall of White Gold Tower, a very troubled time for that ancient people. A time I find most fascinating. My daughter, Fura, was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial Army. I was hoping you might have met her. I haven't heard from her lately. I've tried talking to Captain Aldis but he hasn't been any help.
It would be very sweet of you to get more information about my daughter. Anything you can find out from Captain Aldis would be welcome news.

TESO433: an Akaviri artifact, an amulet that protects its wearer from poisons of any type, looks like a snake coiled around and encircling itself: the eyes of the snake are precious gems

plots: the player has seen Akaviri relics displayed by Countess Narina Carvain
Countess Narina Carvain gives the player a translation of an Akaviri messenger's translated diary, a rough map and a unique key that may help the player in the ruins in Pale Pass

quest.title: Lifting the Vale
quest.objective: bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
tasks: bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
quest.description:
Allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Countess Narina Carvain. I assume you've noticed all of the Akaviri relics I'm displaying.
Well, it's safe to say I'm a collector of sorts. I've invested a great deal of time and money acquiring these bits of ancient history. In fact, I'd be so bold as to proclaim my collection the most complete in all Cyrodiil; perhaps even beyond. Except for one thing.
A particular relic has eluded me for many years. Possessing this piece of Akaviri antiquity would make my collection complete. I'm of course referring to The Draconian Madstone. The stone is a fine bit of Akaviri craftsmanship. Worn like an amulet, this talisman is said to protect the wearer from poisons of any type. The talisman appears as a snake coiled around and encircling itself. The eyes of the snake are supposed to be precious gems or some such. Through my sources, I've learned that the last reported location of the Draconian Madstone was the ruins at Pale Pass.
If you retrieve the Draconian Madstone for me, I'll be happy to compensate you by rewarding you with another Akaviri artifact. Are you in the game?
Let me tell you how you're going to find the talisman. I've come into the possession of a diary written by an Akaviri messenger. I suspect that the text within can lead you to the ruins. Here's a translation of the passages we could still read. It was quite damaged. I've also included a rough map that was drawn in the diary as well. I'm also providing you with a unique key that was supposedly found with the diary. I'm assuming it will prove useful when you arrive at the site.

plots: the player asked Sinderion to train them

quest.title: Alchemy Training

bring a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad to Sinderion
quest.description:
Training? Oh, I'm afraid that's not my area of expertise. I'm very focused on wines right now, you see.
Wonderful thing, wine. It's all about the balance. The flavor, the bouquet, the consistency... just wonderful. I'm sorry, what? Training... right. I'll make you a deal: you fetch me a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad, and I'll think about it.
Both vineyards, Tamika's and Surilie Brothers. Vintage 399. Oh, what a good year that was...

TESO175: the female guildmaster of the Fighters Guild

plots: Modryn Oreyn has been investigating the Blackwood Company: they are a danger to the Fighters Guild
the Fighters Guild was contracted by Argoth to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart: Modryn Oreyn went in there with twenty good men, and left with five
Vitellus Donton was not one of the survivors: he died while covering the Fighters Guild members' retreat
Argoth is dead and the artifact is gone after the Blackwood Company supposedly finished the contract instead of the Fighters Guild
Vilena Donton is not going to know about this mission: it's the player's choice to accept the mission

quest.title: Azani Blackheart
quest.objective: help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
tasks: help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
quest.description:
Good. You're here. We've got duties to attend to.
I've been looking into the Blackwood Company. Heard some disturbing things. We know they're a danger to us. And we know they're good at what they do.
I've heard stories, but nothing I can prove is true. Maybe they've got a mage working with them. Maybe they're just well trained. All I know for sure is that they'll accept any contract, and they'll do anything to complete it. And they don't care who gets in the way.
We were contracted by a wizard, Argoth, to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart, a ruthless bandit leader. I went in there with twenty men. I left with five. Vitellus Donton wasn't one of them. He died covering our retreat. I snooped around. Apparently, the Blackwood Company completed that contract for us. I went in there with twenty good men. I can't believe that bunch finished the job. There's more. Argoth -- he's dead, the artifact gone. Sounds like a set-up. Maybe they made a deal with Blackheart. I don't know. But I'll find out.
Now we find out what really happened. And we let it be known. I want to show the people who the Blackwood Company really are. I can't order you do this with me. It's dangerous, and Vilena Donton isn't going to know about it. It's your choice.
If you accept this mission, we leave as soon as you're ready. I want to investigate Blackheart's stronghold at Arpenia. Meet me at the Leyawiin guild hall. We'll go from there.

TESO160: an extensive, well-guarded monastery, in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal

quest.title: Turning a Blind Eye
quest.objective: return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone

return to the Gray Fox with Savilla's Stone
quest.description:
I have need of your special gifts. There is an item, hidden away in a remote monastery. I need you to go get it for me.
The monastery is extensive and well guarded, so you should make sure to be well prepared. Should you succeed, I will pay you well for your services.
The monastery is called the Temple of the Ancestor Moths. It is where retired, blind Moth priests go to wait out the rest of their days. I will mark the location on your map. Look for it in the far northeast of Cyrodiil, beyond Cheydinhal.
I need you to acquire Savilla's Stone. It is a large crystal with special properties that I need to gain... advantage. Remember, do not shed innocent blood. However, there is no bloodprice for slaying the stone's guardians, human or inhuman. When I receive word that Savilla's Stone is missing, I will be here waiting for you.

TESS263: catacombs filled with Potema's undead minions

quest.description:
Ah Potema, the Wolf Queen. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history. She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
And now Potema has been summoned in spirit form. Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs. A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
You were there when Potema was summoned. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to stop her from returning to the living. I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.

The people of Bravil aren't talking, but you might try asking around, butter them up a bit.
Get to it.

TESO461: an old man who used to be a warrior

All that matters to me now is Malene. I'm no fool. I know she'd never be interested in an old man like me. It's enough just to be around her, to be in her company.
Well, if you're dead set on learning something from me, then how about you do a little something for me, first? Something for her, to be honest.
I'd like to get her a gift of a sort. Nothing terribly fancy, and something useful... How about a nice silver pitcher, and a set of four glasses. Here's 50 gold to cover the costs, that should be more than enough. Come see me when you've got everything, and we'll talk more.

Find her. Tell her I want apple cabbage stew, with some canis root tea. After all, I don't make my own tea. I am a master wizard of the house Telvanni. Other people make tea for me.
You are not my servant? Obviously not, or you would have a cup of tea in your hands. I supposed you want to be asked nicely. Very well.
Please, oh hero of Skyrim. Please find Varona. I shall be ever so grateful.

Can you help me pay off my debt? You should go talk with Sapphire about it.

quest.title: The One That Got Away
quest.objective: recover Heide's fishing rod

quest.description:
I just escaped with my life from a friggin' Elder Guardian, and now I run into you, my least favorite person in the whole world.
The damn Elder Guardian swallowed the hook, line, and sinker of my fishing rod while I was out in the sea fishing on my boat. It must have eaten the whole fishing rod after it slipped from my grip into the sea.
I shouldn't have gone fish so close to the ocean monument far south of this village. I just couldn't see the turquoise stones that make up the monument before it was too late. Who even built those dangerous underwater temples anyway?
I have a proposition for you: recover my fishing rod from the Elder Guardian, and I'll set you up with enough cooked salmon to last your lifetime. We might even become friends. First, you have to find the Elder Guardian, and kill it.
Elder Guardians are one-eyed, large, pale, evil pufferfish. They can shoot laser, and make you fatigued when you get close to them.

TESS905: the player's teacher in conjuration magic

plots: the player has advanced quickly in their conjuration studies
Phinis Gestor will teach the player the spell to summon the Dremora, but it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event

quest.title: Your Will Be Done
quest.objective: learn powerful, new conjuration spells
tasks: summon an unbound Dremora, prove that you are in control, and order the Dremora bring you a sigil stone from an Oblivion gate
quest.description:
How quickly you've advanced. Most impressive. There are spells yet to be learned, powerful spells that can more closely and more permanently bind creatures to your will. These spells are difficult, even for one as skilled as I. To even begin to inscribe them, I need something very special. A sigil stone from an Oblivion gate.
I do not have one in my possession. Nor do you, I'm sure. So we require a Dremora to retrieve one for us. You will summon one, and order it to bring a sigil stone to you. I will then inscribe the spells for you.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora. Summoning an Unbound Dremora is not like other Conjuration spells. It will not simply do your bidding. You must first prove you are in control.
I will teach you the spell to summon the Dremora, but know that it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event. Here is the spell you need. Go to the top of the Hall of Attainment; I have prepared a place for you there.

TESO402: the lady of light, one of the Daedric Princes

plots: the player has summoned Meridia by the detritus of the profane
Meridia hates the undead and necromancers

quest.title: Meridia Smites Necromancers
quest.objective: wipe out a band of necromancers
tasks: wipe out a band of necromancers
quest.description:
By the detritus of the profane, I am brought forth. And by your offering, you have made the profane your interest, mortal.
The undead are foul, unnatural things. Some of my rivals take pleasure in these abominations. Not Meridia. I wish these creatures destroyed. Hidden behind a door, deep in Howling Cave, are necromancers. They rob graves for the materials to raise their undead armies.
Find these necromancers. Destroy them and their abominations. Do this, and earn the gratitude of Meridia. You shall have the Ring of Khajiiti and go with my blessing.

TL2169: a crypt crawling with the Sturmbeorn in the Path of the Honored Dead

The scroll should allow us to heal the Estherians who have been corrupted by evil spirits. Unfortunately, the Sturmbeorn have already entered the crypt, and I have been unable to get past them.
Can I ask you to attempt to retrieve the scroll? I will wait here in the Path of the Honored Dead for your return. Should you succeed, I will see what I can do to provide you with some equipment more fitting a hero of your stature.

MC56: a crafting ingredient that powers up contraptions

plots: Harry wants comfort
the player is an infamous person

quest.title: Brain Over Brawl
quest.objective: give 10 pistons to Harry
quest.description:
You are the person who's been causing trouble in these parts, aren't you?
Why don't we put your energy to a better use? I'm a mason, which means that I have to move large quantities of stone from one place to another. I'd like to automate that process with pistons. That would save me from backache.
The problem is I don't have the materials for making pistons, or the know-how to craft them. This is where you enter the picture. Craft 10 pistons, and then bring them to me. I know that you need 3 wooden planks, 4 cobblestone, an iron ingot, and Redstone Dust for crafting a piston.
Some quarts pillars broke while we were transporting them. You could have the remaining 32 Nether Quartz from them.

TESO244: mystical scrolls that simultaneously archive both past and future events, the Gray Fox needs one

plots: the Gray Fox has worked for eleven years planning this final heist: Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information he needed
the Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached: the player will take the Old Way instead
the Gray Fox gives the player the key for the gate to the section of the sewers housing the Old Way

quest.title: The Ultimate Heist
quest.objective: steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace
tasks: locate the Old Way and use it to travel to the Imperial Palace
steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace
quest.description:
This is the big one. This is the heist that will be written about and talked about for decades to come. We are going to steal one of the Elder Scrolls from the Imperial Palace. Are you ready for this challenge?
There is no buyer. This is for glory, not for money. Our names will become legend. I also have a personal need for this particular scroll. As for your compensation, I ask you to trust me. If my plan works, you will get a reward worth far more than mere money.
I have worked for eleven years planning this heist. Savilla's Stone provided the last bit of information I needed. The Elder Scrolls are kept in the Imperial Palace behind a door that cannot be breached. Savilla's Stone has revealed a path around this door. You will have to travel the Old Way. Once used as an escape route for Imperial Emperors, it has been forgotten for centuries.
The Old Way can be found in the Imperial Sewers. Here is the key for the gate to that section of the sewers. My scrying with Savilla's Stone has provided clues, but not the details. I know the tools you will need there, but not the obstacles themselves. The Boots of Springheel Jak will allow you to leap to an unreachable place. They will also protect you from a long fall. The Arrow of Extrication is the only way to unlock the final door. Take them both.
Once you are inside the Palace itself, you need to find the reading room. The blind priests will deliver a scroll to you there. I arranged for the notable Celia Camoran to want to read a particular Elder Scroll. Don't ask how. However, she will be... unavoidably detained. You will take her place. Do not speak to the priests. They are blindfolded and will not realize it isn't her unless you speak. As the guildmaster, I am waiving bloodprice for anyone you kill during this heist. However, I can't stop the Watch from putting a price on your head.
I have written it all down for you in this book. I've chosen you because you are the best. Good luck.
