Please, help a fellow in love. I have 27 pumpkin pies I can give you.

TESS172: a powerful woman with criminal connections

plots: the player asked Vex information about Vald

quest.title: Vald's Debt
quest.objective: ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
tasks: talk to Maven Black-Briar about erasing Vald's debts
ask Vald to betray Mercer Frey
quest.description:
Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

TESS740: an ancient ghost of a soldier
TESS743: Ghost of Old Hroldan's long-dead brother-in-arms

plots: the Ghost of Old Hroldan thinks that the player is Hjalti

quest.title: The Ghost of Old Hroldan
quest.objective: put the Ghost of Old Hroldan to rest
tasks: find Hjalti's sword ,and give it to the Ghost of Old Hroldan
put the Ghost of Old Hroldan to rest
quest.description:
You don't remember me, Hjalti? Two campaigns we served together. You saved my life time and time again. You promised me, Hjalti. You promised that when we sacked Hroldan, you would make me your sworn brother.
And I've waited. Even after the enemies' arrows dug into my chest and their hammers crushed my bones. I've waited.
Give me your sword, Hjalti. That we may become brothers as you promised.

plots: Dagon wants knowledge
the player is an infamous person

quest.title: Lost Lore
quest.objective: collect "Secrets of the Overworld" for Dagon
tasks: collect "Secrets of the Overworld" for Dagon
quest.description:
Arrg! Important books are just rotting away in remote places, and no one is doing a damn thing about recovering them. All that precious knowledge... lost forever.
Wait. Aren't you that infamous, misbehaving wreck of a person? I'm sorry, I have more important things to worry about than you. Unless, you want to start cleaning up your act.
I know for sure that there's this book, "Secrets of the Overworld", just laying around somewhere withing a jungle temple. Just think what moist jungle air is doing to that precious tome of forgotten knowledge! I need to find it, and collect it for me. I can't leave the village myself; no one else can tend my library!
I'm willing to pay a lot for the book: 5 blocks of emerald.

BG2148: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District
BG2149: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District
BG2150: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District
Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District
BG2151: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District

plots: Khellor Ahmson saw Officer Roenall using his authority against the player in a corrupt manner
any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go through him: guards cannot do anything about Officer Roenall
Officer Roenall's personal records may reveal his fondness for gems

quest.title: Officer Roenall's Corrupt Actions
quest.objective: bring the evidence of Officer Roenall's corrupt actions to Corgeig Axehand
tasks: bring the evidence of Officer Roenall's corrupt actions to Corgeig Axehand
quest.description:
I am Khellor Ahmson, a mere guard.
I saw what happened, and I share your helplessness. Any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go THROUGH him, so you can imagine how many get through.
This did not come from me, for if my indiscretion against Roenall were to get out, I should be thrown from the military. There is one way you can get to him.
Roenall is quite corrupt and more than willing to exercise his power. You are not monitored as we, so you can do something that I or another guard cannot.
Look to the docks and a man named Barg. Examine him and what he does, and you are sure to see what I mean. You might also wish to pry into Roenall's personal records. They may reveal something of his fondness for gems. I did not tell you this... and I certainly did not say his records are in his home northwest of the main government building in the Government District.
Think on what I've said, and bring anything you learn to Corgeig Axehand in the Government District main building. He is Roenall's commander.

MC19: a woman tired of regular food

plots: Bella wants comfort
the player can craft golden apples by combining an apple with gold ingots

quest.title: Fine Dining
quest.objective: bring 5 golden apples to Bella
quest.description:
I'm sick and tired of eating the same boring, mundane food every day. I want to taste something a bit more refined. Something like golden apples.
Could you help a lady in distress? Bring me 5 golden apples to sample from, and I'll procure you a diamond block. That should leave a sweet taste in your mouth, as well.
Golden apples can be found in various dangerous corners of the world. If you don't fancy exploring, you can craft golden apples by combining an apple with gold ingots.

TESS343: the welcoming headmaster of the Bards College
TESS350: a part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim, a poem dealing with King Olaf

plots: Jarl Elisif has forbidden the burning of King Olaf, a festival put on by the Bards College: to convince Jarl Elisif change her mind, Viarmo wants to read King Olaf's Verse

quest.title: Tending the Flames
quest.objective: become a member of the Bards College
tasks: become a member of the Bards College
quest.description:
Welcome to the Bards College. I am Viarmo, the headmaster here.
Always a pleasure to meet a prospective bard. You should be aware that many apply but we accept very few people. When possible, we ask applicants to perform tasks the college needs completed. In this case, I do have a task befitting an aspiring bard...
Jarl Elisif has forbidden the Burning of King Olaf, a Festival put on by the Bards College. We need to change her mind. To convince her I want to read King Olaf's Verse. A part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim. Unfortunately the poem was lost long ago.
According to our histories keeper, the portion of the Edda dealing with King Olaf might still exist in Dead Men's Respite. I need you to retrieve the poem.

TL24: a male bear-mage with enchanting tools

plots: Baldrick the Enchanter can't enchant anything without enchanting tools

quest.title: Hidden Costs
quest.objective: bring enchanting tools to Baldrick the Enchanter
tasks: Go to Path of the Honored Dead.
search Path of the Honored Dead for a Beornen
bring enchanting tools to Baldrick the Enchanter
quest.description:
Welcome! Welcome, my friend. I have numerous enchantments available... weapons, armor, trinkets, and the like. Or, rather, I would, if I hadn't lost my enchantment kit!
Maybe you can help me. I've heard there's a Beornen shaman or something out in the Path of the Honored Dead, who has the kind of enchanting tools I need. If you could locate this bear-mage and acquire those tools, I would happily give you your first enchantment, free of charge!

plots: Larina stole Pantea's flute and sold it to a necromancer

quest.title: Pantea's Flute
quest.objective: recover Pantea's flute for her
quest.description:
That damn fool! I should wring Larina's neck! That fool student of mine stole my flute and sold it to some necromancer in Hob's Fall Cave.
Apparently Larina told him some story about the flute being able to make the dead dance. It's just a flute. A really old and valuable flute, but just a flute. I just got a ransom note for it. That flute has been handed down for seventeen generations!
Well don't just stand there. Go get my flute! I don't have any money to give you. but I can show you a few tricks I learned playing for wizards.

BG2240: a young man, and a faithful soldier
BG2241: the missing son of Countess Santele, and the primary witness in the traitor investigation

plots: someone opened a secret gate into Saradush: the enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards
the Saradush guard found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and Kiser Jhaeri
Countess Santele told the Saradush guard that Ardic Santele had implicated Mateo before Ardic Santele disappeared
the jailer will let the player see Mateo

quest.title: Justice for Mateo
quest.objective: discover the real traitor
quest.description:
My name is Captain Samand, and I'm a very busy man right now.
A few days ago, someone opened a secret gate into the town — Saradush could easily have been overrun. We just discovered the traitor was a young man named Mateo. There's no doubt in my mind that *someone* betrayed us. The enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards. There is no way to open that entrance from the outside. But Mateo is a faithful soldier, not the type of man to betray Saradush.
An alarm was raised, and my soldiers arrived only a few moments after the gate was opened. We found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and the merchant Kiser Jhaeri. We didn't get a chance to complete our investigations. Ardic, the son of the Countess Santele, disappeared. He was our primary witness. Our attention was focused on the vile Kiser Jhaeri, but we had no proof. Then the countess told us that Ardic, her son, had implicated Mateo before he disappeared.
If you wish to investigate further, I will not stand in your way. Speak to Mateo in his cell. The jailer will let you see him.

TESO59: the prince of madness, one of the Daedric Princes
TESO61: the capital city of Sheogorath's realm
TESO63: Sheogorath's Chamberlain who knows a lot

plots: Sheogorath gives the player summon Haskill spell for their previous services
the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia show the player what New Sheoth truly is
once the player understands what Sheogorath's Realm is, the player might understand why it's important to keep it intact

quest.title: Understanding Madness
quest.objective: meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
tasks: seek out the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia
meet the Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia, and join their courts
quest.description:
I'm Sheogorath, Prince of Madness. And other things. I'm not talking about them. As you should know by now.
You've run a maze like a good little rat, but no cheese for you yet. Well, maybe a little. I've granted you a new spell - the ability to summon Haskill, my Chamberlain, to aid you in your travels. He knows a lot. More than he knows.
Now we're going to give you a taste of where you have found yourself. You're going to learn. Two halves, two rulers, two places within my palace. Meet and greet. Do what they will, so you know what they're about.
The Duke of Mania and the Duchess of Dementia. Seek them out, and let them show you what New Sheoth is. You might be surprised. Once you understand what My Realm is, you might understand why it's important to keep it intact. And maybe you'll make some friends along the way. That's always nice!

TESS809: a famous bookshop far away from Solstheim
TESS810: a ship that sank off the coast of Solstheim, and turned into a reaver den

plots: Cindiri Arano sent the Folio to the First Edition to be rebound: they sent it back on the Strident Squall

quest.title: First Edition
quest.objective: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
tasks: locate a Folio for Cindiri Arano
quest.description:
A few months ago, I had sent an important Folio to the First Edition to be rebound. They sent it back to me recently, but it never arrived.
The Folio was aboard the "Strident Squall" or something like that. The damn thing sunk right off the coast of Solstheim. Can you imagine? One of the sailors survived. Poor thing crawled all the way to Raven Rock on his hands and knees. Before he died, he told the guard about the wreck and warned us that it was going to be crawling with reavers.
Could you find the Folio for me? You have no idea how much it hurts losing such a precious item!

TESS41: the Lord of the player and Garan Marethi's vampire clan
TESS992: a chalice that is able to increase the potency of the player's vampiric powers

plots: the player told Garan Marethi that Harkon wants the Bloodstone Chalice without addressing Harkon properly as Lord Harkon
Harkon has owned the Bloodstone Chalice for a long time

quest.title: The Bloodstone Chalice
quest.objective: fill the Bloodstone Chalice for Harkon
tasks: follow Garan Marethi to the Bloodstone Chalice
fill the Bloodstone Chalice for Harkon
quest.description:
Lord Harkon. Remember your place. Now, he wants the Chalice, then.
You've heard of the Bloodstone Chalice? The Chalice has been in Lord Harkon's possession for quite some time now. It is, when used properly, able to increase the potency of our powers.
Lord Harkon has neglected using the Chalice for ages. If he wants it filled now, then grander things are afoot. This is good.
Follow me. I'll take you to the Bloodstone Chalice.

TESS448: a scholar, giving quest via "Heddic's Volunruud Notes"
TESS451: an ancient warrior, and a forefather of Heddic Volunnar
TESS452: notes on Heddic Volunnar's research on Volunruud
TESS453: favored weapons when Tongue Chieftain Kvenel went into battle

plots: Heddic Volunnar is scouting out Volunruud: the relief not far from the entrance hides Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb
the two hidden keys to Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb are ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj

quest.title: Silenced Tongues
quest.objective: unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
tasks: unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
quest.description:
Heddic's Volunruud Notes
by Heddic Volunnar

I was skeptical, but it's obvious now. The old hymns had truth to them! The relief wasn't far from the entrance, just as they said. I've no doubt now that it hides the entrance to Kvenel's tomb.
The two keys must be hidden somewhere nearby - ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj, favored weapons when Kvenel went into battle. I don't dare explore further without hiring bodyguards to accompany me, however. To think - The Tongue Chieftain Kvenel could be entombed behind just a few feet of stone! The ancestor we scarcely believed was real.
Twice damned for planning this foolish scouting trip. I should have hired those sellswords in the first place. Perhaps there's no need. This place is just a tomb, after all, and there are no obvious signs of habitation. It isn't as though the thousand-year dead will mind if I have a look around.

plots: Saffir doesn't like that Amren has been spending so much time looking for his father's old sword

quest.title: A Sharp Heirloom
quest.objective: retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
tasks: retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
quest.description:
I'm Amren, the husband of Saffir.
My Saffir doesn't like that I've been spending so much time looking for my father's old sword. He fed his entire family with the gold he made using that weapon. I'm not about to let it gather dust in some thief's trophy room.
I tracked it to a group of bandits nearby. The place is called Halted Stream Camp. But I'm no fool. I'd need the Whiterun guards or maybe hire some mercenaries to get it. I don't know why I'm saying this, but if you find it out in your travels, I'd be grateful to you.

TESO66: the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman
TESO68: a ship turned into an inn
TESO69: the man who owns the Bloated Float

plots: the player freed Graman gro-Marad from a storage room
not long ago, the Blackwater Brigands stormed the Bloated Float: the Blackwater Brigands took Graman gro-Marad and Ormil hostage and and put the Bloated Float to the sea

quest.title: An Unexpected Voyage
quest.objective: clear a safe path to the top deck for Graman gro-Marad
tasks: clear a safe path to the top deck for Graman gro-Marad
quest.description:
About time someone showed up. Thank you for freeing me. I'm Graman gro-Marad, the Bloated Float's bouncer and helmsman.
I've been locked in that storage room for hours. I don't know exactly what's going on, but not long ago, a gang of thieves calling themselves The Blackwater Brigands stormed the ship. They took myself and Ormil, the Bloated Float's owner, hostage and put the ship to sea. I have no idea what they're after. If you can get me safely to the top deck, I can steer the Float home. But I'm not budging until the coast is clear. I'm used to dealing with drunken louts, not a gang of well-armed thieves.
Good luck... you'll need it.

TL2221: a military officer working for the Professor

plots: the Professor sent the player after the power source in the Scrapworks: the Officer and his troop are on the same mission
the Officer sent his troop to the Abandoned Sawmill: he has not heard from them

quest.title: The Cave-In
quest.objective: clear the way to the Scrapworks
tasks: clear the way to the Scrapworks
quest.description:
So, the Professor sent you after the Power Source? We were on the same mission, but the only way to the Scrapworks is through that pile of rock.
I know the Abandoned Sawmill used to have plenty of explosives from when the place was still in operation - a little bit of dynamite would probably get the job done here.
I sent my troop after it, but haven't heard a thing. If you can head up there and get that dynamite, we could all pass through and get the Professor what he needs.

BG1207: a sword that was created to kill spiders

plots: Chelak found "Spider's Bane"
Chelak went to Cloakwood to clear the spider colony with "Spider's Bane"

quest.title: Spiders in the Cloakwood
quest.objective: investigate what happened to Chelak
quest.description:
He-hello, travelers. I'm Tiber. Could... could I take up some of your time? I would be very grateful if you would just listen to... if you would just help me!
It's my brother, you see. He and I went into the Cloakwood to clear the woods of the spider colony that infests it. I know it sounds foolish... but my brother had found the sword "Spider's Bane"! The sword was created to kill spiders... and we thought we could become famous... the heroes of Cloakwood, and all that. But my brother hasn't returned yet... and it's been more than a week.
Please, could you go into the woods and find him for me? His name's Chelak. My mother would be so shattered if Chelak were to be dead.

TESS427: a mine connected to an old Nordic crypt

plots: Perth warns the player to stay out of Soljund's Sinkhole

quest.title: Soljund's Sinkhole
quest.objective: make Soljund's Sinkhole safe again
quest.description:
Whoa, there. I don't know where you're going, but stay out of that mine. It isn't safe.
We tunneled into an old Nordic crypt. The whole place is crawling with draugr. We're not mining up any ore with those undead around, so I wouldn't go down there if I were you.
You want to clear out the draugr? You're joking, right? Those bone-walkers will tear you limb from limb. But if you want to get yourself killed, go ahead.
I hear talk about a regiment coming to clear the crypt out. We'll see if that happens.

TESS478: a powerful old male priest who was buried long ago
TESS479: a famous male hero of old

plots: Anska's family legend states that they are descendants of Ysgramor

quest.title: A Scroll For Anska
quest.objective: help Anska find a scroll about her family legend
tasks: defeat Vokun, a powerful old priest buried here, with Anska
help Anska find a scroll about her family legend
quest.description:
I'm Anska. Are you here to help?
I've finally located Vokun's crypt! The scroll I'm looking for just has to be here. Maybe you could help find it, I just know it's in here.
Vokun is some old priest buried here long ago. I've been searching for his tomb for a few years now. If Vokun is as powerful as I think, I may need a little help um... dealing with him. With the two of us this should be easy.
You can have anything except the scroll of course. It's probably meaningless to you, but according to family legend it links our bloodline back to Ysgramor himself.

plots: Miles the Moron wants comfort
the player is a friend of Miles the Moron

quest.title: A Service Dog
quest.objective: bring a wolf to Miles the Moron
tasks: bring a wolf to Miles the Moron
quest.description:
Me happy. See a friend. Hello friend!
Me would like me own wolfie. Could help me do things... Wolfies like Wide Woodland. A biggy forest. Tame a wolfie. Bring it to me. Me give you pumpkins. A load of pumpkins.

TESS391: the player's teacher in magic at the College of Winterhold
TESS393: a school for mages in Skyrim
TESS397: the male Arch-Mage of the College of Winterhold
TESS86: a mage's staff that can absorb a tremendous amount of power

plots: the player needs the Staff of Magnus to break through Ancano's dangerous magic

the player knows that the Staff of Magnus is in Labyrinthian: Savos Aren gave Mirabelle Ervine something from Labyrinthian before he died, Mirabelle Ervine gives the player this item and Savos Aren's amulet

quest.title: The Staff of Magnus
quest.objective: bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
tasks: bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
quest.description:
You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.
I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
You know that the staff is in Labyrinthian? Are you... Are you sure? The staff is there? That can't be a coincidence. The Arch-Mage. Before... before he died. He... He gave me something just a little while ago. He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came. I think... I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him. Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think would do you the most good now. Take it, and get out of here.
Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us. If we can't stop this, what happens to the rest of Skyrim?

plots: Captain Wayfinder's mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house
Captain Wayfinder's sailors lost their last trade, Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold, after getting drunk

quest.title: Salty Sea-Dogs
quest.objective: bring Fine-Cut Void Salts back to Captain Wayfinder
tasks: bring Fine-Cut Void Salts back to Captain Wayfinder
quest.description:
I am a sea captain by inheritance, as my men are fond of saying. Can't blame them, my mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house.
I've been trying to find new areas of business, trying to win the sailors' respect, but I keep having problems. Take the last trade we did. Some Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold. Plenty of coin if you know who to sell it to.
What happened to the Salts? Sailors are what happened to them. They got drunk and ended up losing the merchandise in some cave. If you're not afraid of little exploring, I'll pay good gold to get those Salts.

plots: Caleb wants comfort
the player is a known villain

quest.title: Affordable Cooling
quest.objective: bring some ice to Caleb
quest.description:
I know of your dark deeds. I do not want any trouble from you.
However... if you have had a change of heart, I could use a little help. The hot desert air of this village is making me rather uncomfortable. I could stave off the heat, if I had some ice.
Tell you what, bring me ice, and you may still redeem yourself, villain, and net yourself 42 cacti. Ice is commonplace in snowy tundras, in frosted rivers.

TESS193: in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest
in the southwest reaches of the realm, in the pine forest
TESS504: the passphrase to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

plots: Astrid officially welcomes the player to the Dark Brotherhood

quest.title: Sanctuary
quest.objective: begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
tasks: find the entrance to the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, and answer "Silence, my brother." when questioned by the black door
begin your new life as a member of the Dark Brotherhood, and see Astrid
quest.description:
I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family: the Dark Brotherhood.
In the southwest reaches of the realm, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins.
I'll see you at home.

TESO175: the leader of the Blackwood Company, and a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel
TESO460: an abominable tree, and the source of the Fighters Guild's problems

plots: Modryn Oreyn has one final duty for the player to perform
everyone is in danger, as long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap from the Hist Tree
Ri'Zakar will have the Hist Tree well guarded

quest.title: The Hist
quest.objective: return to the Blackwood Company hall to destroy the Hist Tree and anyone that stands in your way
tasks: find Ri'Zakar's key that opens the door to the Hist tree
return to the Blackwood Company hall to destroy the Hist Tree and anyone that stands in your way
quest.description:
It is time for decisive action. I have one more duty for you to perform. It is clear to me what must be done. The Hist Tree must be destroyed. This tree is the source of our problems. It is an abomination of nature, and it must be destroyed. As long as the Blackwood Company has access to the sap, we are all in danger. I fear they no longer know what they do.
You must find a way to destroy the Hist, though I can imagine Ri'Zakar will have it well guarded. He's a warrior, a battle-hardened mercenary who's spent time all over Tamriel. He'll keep his prize tree locked away. You'll need to find his key.
Expect an unfriendly welcome at their hall. Finish it.

BG1150: Nadine's youngest son, who knows how to take care of himself

plots: Euric ran away from home
Nadine gives the player a good luck talisman

quest.title: Nadine and Euric
quest.objective: give Euric a good luck talisman and return to Nadine
tasks: give Euric a good luck talisman and return to Nadine
quest.description:
I, Nadine, desperately need someone's help.
Euric, my youngest son, has run away again... He's always had a touch of the wanderer in him and he knows how to take care of himself, but... Oh, I'm just worried sick. This city gets more dangerous every day... If you find him, could you give him this good luck talisman? I'm sure we'd all sleep a little better.
Let me give you this necklace as a token of my thanks upon your return. I don't know if it's worth anything but it has been in the family for years.

plots: "Letter from Calcelmo" is addressed toward the player

quest.title: An Offer
quest.objective: help Calcelmo with his research
tasks: bring the Dwemer sword you bough from Warmaiden's to Calcelmo
quest.description:
Letter from Calcelmo
by Calcelmo

Dragonborn,
It has come to my attention you may have recently acquired a certain Dwemer sword from Warmaiden's.
I'm not sure how such an object came to find itself resting there... but I've been trying to obtain one for my research.
If you still have it, or if not, find another one, I would be most appreciative if you were to bring it to me here in Markarth. I will pay handsomely.

Sincerely,
Calcelmo

TESS193: a cruel, old female orphanage headmistress, killed by the player

plots: Astrid woke the player up from their sleep
Aventus Aretino was looking for the Dark Brotherhood: Grelod the Kind was a Dark Brotherhood contract, and the player must pay for killing her

quest.title: With Friends Like These...
quest.objective: kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
tasks: turn around, and select the person who shall not leave the room alive
kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
quest.description:
Sleep well? Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole. A kill you must repay.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.

plots: Scar knows the player
every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city
possible tracks of a many-legged centipede-like monster have been found

quest.title: Missing Citizens
quest.objective: discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens, and come see Scar
tasks: patrol and find an entrance to the sewers
discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens, and come see Scar
quest.description:
It is I, Scar, second-in-command of the Flaming Fist. I have another job you might be interested in. You'll be well paid for your services.
The problem is this: Every night people have been disappearing from the streets of the city. My men have been scouring the city trying to find the culprit, but so far to no avail. People have begun to get scared, and very few are willing to leave their homes at night. Something has to be done, and quickly. Would you be willing to take the job? I'd pay you 300 gold in advance with a 1,000 gold bonus if you discover what's been happening with the disappearing citizens.
Your job is really simple. All I want you to do is patrol the east of the city and find an entrance to the sewers. Perhaps you'll get lucky and find out what's been happening. If you do find out what's been happening, come to see me at the Flaming Fist barracks. Our only clue so far has led us to the sewers, so if you want to explore them first, it would probably be a good idea. Also, we've found tracks of some many-legged creature, perhaps a centipede-like monster.

TESS274: the man who leads the Stormcloaks

plots: General Tullius is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel

quest.title: Extinguishing the Flames of Rebellion
quest.objective: put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
tasks: fight your way in Ulric's castle, and make Ulfric face justice
put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
quest.description:
All right. It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion. You all have fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point.
Ulfric thinks he can hide behind the walls of his castle. But we will fight our way in and drag him out through the rubble to face justice. Because this is the end for them, the Stormcloaks will fight like cornered rats. They will be fierce and crafty. But they are no match for Legionnaires.
You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating. The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded.
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

plots: the player told Jessa that her father is dead

quest.title: The Locket
quest.objective: bring the Locket to Jessa
quest.description:
Oh, my poor father - I cannot believe that he is gone! Dear father...
Please try to retrieve the Locket - it belonged to my father. I cannot bear to think that it is lost in this foul place, corroding away in swamp water. He must have dropped it somewhere around here...

TESO416: a master trainer in light armor

plots: the player told J'bari that they want light armor training from him

quest.title: Light Armor Training
quest.objective: give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
tasks: give an unenchanted Elven cuirass to J'bari
quest.description:
If you want training from me, you're going to have to get something for me first.
I need a new Elven cuirass. Nothing fancy, nothing enchanted. Just a decent piece of armor. You get that for me, and I'll train you. That's the deal.

plots: Will wants comfort
the player is an enemy of Will

quest.title: Spooky Shenanigans
quest.objective: give a carved pumpkin to Will
tasks: give a carved pumpkin to Will
quest.description:
Try to catch me, you big meanie! I bet you can't even carve pumpkins!
You wanna try to obtain a carved pumpkin and give it to me? I surely will not do any kind of pranks with it... like sneaking up on grownups... pinky swear.
Perhaps I'd even share my ten cookies with you. That should teach to to be nicer!

plots: blindness is abhorrent to Helm
the Cult of the Eyeless is hiding in the sewers: the player must infiltrate the sewers and find a hidden passage leading to the Cult of the Eyeless

quest.title: Investigate the Cult of the Eyeless
quest.objective: investigate the Cult of the Eyeless
tasks: investigate the Cult of the Eyeless
quest.description:
The task I ask will be treacherous, but you seem capable. Serve well, and you will be rewarded. Display any treachery, and it will be seen. Now to the task.
A cult of the eyeless has emerged: He of the Unsleeping Eyes must know of this cult. The blindness they promote is abhorrent to Helm. We ask you to investigate and identify the cult.
The Vigilant One informs us that the cult is underground and close, but we cannot see past the sewers. You must infiltrate it, as friend or conqueror. You must suffer the filth of the sewers to find the filth of the cult. They are not hiding amidst the pipes, so there must be a passage leading further away.
Our resources are thin at the moment, but an ally of Helm and servant of Torm is awaiting you in the sewers now. Seek Keldorn to serve with you. Faith guide you both.

TESS46: an ex-student of the College of Winterhold

plots: Orthorn stole books from Urag gro-Shub and left to join the summoners at Fellglow Keep

quest.title: Hitting the Books
quest.objective: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
tasks: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
quest.description:
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.

plots: "Dead Drop Orders #4" has been addressed to the player: the player is a Silencer of the Dark Brotherhood
the player killed J'Ghasta for Lucien Lachance before
Shaleez was banished from her home village near Black Marsh/Morrowind border for a murder of a Dark Elven family: the Morag Tong can't reach Shaleez

quest.title: Final Justice
quest.objective: assassinate Shaleez
quest.description:
Dead Drop Orders #4
by Lucien Lachance

J'Ghasta is dead! Well done! I was right about you, Silencer. You are a useful tool indeed. Let's see if you can continue to impress me.
You must journey now to the Flooded Mine. There you will find Shaleez, an Argonian hunter who was banished from her village near the Black Marsh/Morrowind border for the brutal murder of a Dark Elven family. Relatives of the murdered family members have located Shaleez, and demand retribution. And, since the assignment is a bit far for Morrowind's Morag Tong to handle, the Dark Brotherhood has been commissioned to perform the elimination.
Be warned, Silencer! Shaleez is a skilled and deadly hunter, and will fight like the desperate fugitive she is.
After Shaleez has been eliminated, your reward and another contract will be waiting at the dead drop located in a coffin, just outside the ruins of Fort Redman.

plots: the player is meeting Harkon for the first time: Harkon and his family are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim
the player returned Harkon's daughter and her Elder Scroll to him

quest.title: Bloodline
quest.objective: become a vampire, or be banished from Castle Volkihar
tasks: decide whether you want to become a vampire or remain mortal
become a vampire, or be banished from Castle Volkihar
quest.description:
I am Harkon, lord of this court. By now, my daughter will have told you what we are. We are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim.
You have done me a great service, and now you must be rewarded. There is but one gift I can give that is equal in value to the Elder Scroll and my daughter.
I offer you my blood. Take it, and you will walk as a lion among sheep. Men will tremble at your approach, and you will never fear death again.
However, if you refuse my gift you will be prey, like all mortals. I will spare your life this once, but you will be banished from this hall.
I await your decision.

plots: the player told Finnas that the player came here to rescue him, Snowbell and Sunbeam

quest.title: The Not-So-Lost Husband
quest.objective: tell Bellethe that Finnas is okay
tasks: take Snowbell and Sunbeam to Bellethe
tell Bellethe that Finnas is okay
quest.description:
You ... you came to rescue us?  Thank the guardians!
I've managed to keep Snowbell and Sunbeam safe up here, but I injured my leg. I can't make my way out of this cave while carrying them. If you'll take them to Bellethe, I'll follow you out at my own pace. Tell Bellethe that I'm okay. My thanks to you for your help!

TESS304: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild, and a Nightingale

plots: the binding terms of the oath with Nocturnal: the player will be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises, and upon the player's death, the player's spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians

quest.title: Trinity Restored
quest.objective: transact the oath with Nocturnal and become one of the Nightingales
tasks: undergo the ceremony to become a Nightingale
transact the oath with Nocturnal and become one of the Nightingales
quest.description:
Are you ready to transact the Oath with Nocturnal?
By transacting the Oath with Nocturnal, you're entering into a business deal. You'll be provided all of the power and knowledge befitting a Nightingale. You're free to use those powers as you see fit to further your own goals or the goals of the Thieves Guild.
In return, you'll be required to defend the Twilight Sepulcher and everything within when the need arises. More importantly, upon your death, your spirit will be bound to the Twilight Sepulcher as one of its guardians.
Once the Oath has been struck, the terms are binding. Knowing this, are you ready to undergo the ceremony?

TESS28: the player's leader in the Dawnguard
Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins
TESS29: a smart Breton girl, who is good with tinkering and fascinated with the Dwemer and their weapons
Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins
TESS30: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins
Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins
TESS31: a big, brutish Nord man, who trains animals, especially trolls
Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

plots: the Dawnguard is fighting against powerful vampires, who have an Elder Scroll

quest.title: A New Order
quest.objective: recruit Isran's old allies for the Dawnguard
tasks: find Sorine Jurard and Gunmar, and recruit them for the Dawnguard
recruit Isran's old allies for the Dawnguard
quest.description:
We're up against powerful vampires, unlike anything we've seen before. And they have an Elder Scroll.
There are people I've met and worked with over the years. We need their skills, their talents, if we're going to survive this.
I think we'll want Sorine Jurard. Breton girl, whip-smart and good with tinkering. Fascination with the Dwemer. Weapons in particular. Last I knew, she was out in the Reach, convinced she was about to find the biggest dwarven ruins yet. You'll also want to find Gunmar. Big brute of a Nord, hates vampires almost as much as I do. Got it into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear.
If you can find them, we might have a chance.

TL2124: the innermost part of the Swarm Point

plots: Hareph sent the player to find his demolition crew: he gave the player explosives
some Skara hives seem to be infected with something

quest.title: Blight of the Bugs
quest.objective: discover what has been blighting Skara eggs
tasks: find the rigged Skara hives and detonate them
discover what has been blighting Skara eggs
quest.description:
Ah, Hareph sent you with some explosives. Finally some good news!
Don't bother looking for the rest of the crew - I'm the only one that survived. 
There's something wrong with some of the Skara hives - they seem to be infected. You'll need to locate the rigged hives and detonate them, then descend into the Brood Hive itself and destroy any infected eggs you find. Perhaps you will discover what has been blighting the eggs!
This is a great task, but it must be done. We will all be in your debt.

TESS637: the ancient goddess of humankind and beasts, who teaches us to respect the beasts
TESS638: an ancient tradition, and a test to prove yourself to Kyne

plots: Froki thinks that the Divines are impostor gods
Froki gives the player the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever: this will compel the guardian to appear when the player reaches the guardian's lair

quest.title: Kyne's Sacred Trials
quest.objective: participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
tasks: defeat the guardian wolf, crab and skeever and return to Froki
participate in Kyne's Sacred Trials by hunting the guardian beasts blessed by Kyne
quest.description:
The Divines are stolen idols! Impostor gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.
Kyne's Sacred Trials is an old tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True hunters are those who survive the Trials.
Do you think you're strong enough for Kyne's blessing? I would be glad to pass this tradition down. You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne. I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.
Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

plots: Dean wants knowledge
Dean has heard that the player helps people

quest.title: New Materials
quest.objective: bring 10 scutes to Dean
quest.description:
I have made all sorts of things from leather: tunics, hats, and even little tent-houses. There's nothing new I can create...
Could you perhaps help me out of this sea of creative depression? You do help people? Please find me a new material to work with! Perhaps turtle scutes would work...
Please help me get my hands on ten scutes: you can get them from turtles on sandy beaches. I'll give you a stack of leather for your services!

plots: Lord Drad took Malacath's ogres: ogres are Malacath's little brothers
Lord Drad put Malacath's ogres in chains, working in the mines

quest.title: Malacath's Family of Monsters
quest.objective: rescue ogres from slavery under Lord Drad
tasks: let Malacath's ogres loose and get them out of Lord Drad's mines
rescue ogres from slavery under Lord Drad
quest.description:
You want something from Malacath? Then, if you're smart, you do what I tell you.
Lord Drad took my ogres. Says he owns them. Lying maggot! They're MY ogres! Lord Drad put my little brothers in chains, working in the mines. I don't like that.
Get over to Lord Drad's estate. Let my ogres loose, and get them out! Okay? Get going!
You get a present, Volendrung. Be nice to my little brothers!

plots: Ranarr-Jo thinks that Cindanwe can control minds

quest.title: Everything In Its Place
quest.objective: liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
tasks: liberate Ranarr-Jo and others from mind control
quest.description:
I'm Ranarr-Jo.
Perhaps you could help us? But why should I trust you? You might be, you know... one of Them.
Our situation is desperate, she controls our minds... but wait, I've said too much.
Talk to my Kishashi. If she will trust you, I will trust you.

TESS11: a province half a continent away from the player and Serana
TESS9: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

plots: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls

quest.title: Prophet
quest.objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
tasks: ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls
find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
quest.description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.

TESO339: Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks
Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks
TESO359: a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target, cannot pierce armor

plots: the Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis against Adamus Phillida

quest.title: Permanent Retirement
quest.objective: assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
tasks: assassinate Adamus Phillida when he is out of his Legion armor with or without the Rose of Sithis
quest.description:
I have another assassination contract for you.
Do you recall the name Adamus Phillida? The Imperial Legion pest? It's time he joined Death in the Void. Think you're up to the task?
Adamus Phillida has spent his entire career investigating the Dark Brotherhood, interrupting our contracts, killing our family members! We tried to eliminate Phillida, of course, but failed on three separate occasions. He's a powerful man, and was surrounded by powerful associates. Now the Legion's pig's years of service have come to an end. He has retired. Phillida must not be allowed such a victory! His destiny is... darker. Phillida now resides in Leyawiin, in the City Watch barracks, an honored guest of the soldiers there. He is, in fact, more vulnerable than ever.
The Black Hand has sanctioned the Rose of Sithis. It is a magic arrow specifically enchanted to kill its target. In this case, Phillida. As long as the arrow hits Phillida, he will die. But it cannot pierce armor! Shoot while Phillida is armored, and the Rose will be wasted. Travel to Leyawiin. Track Phillida. Learn his schedule. Observe when he removes that blasted Legion armor! And then, let fly the Rose of Sithis! Kill Phillida in any way, Rose or not, and the contract is complete. But to receive a bonus, you must go beyond murder. You must send a message! Once Phillida is dead, take the very finger from his corpse, the one that bears an Imperial Legion signet ring! Deposit this finger in the desk of Phillida's successor, in his office in the Prison Barracks, in the Imperial City! Do this, and the bonus is yours.

plots: goblins killed Kayleen while Corrick Northwode was away on business

quest.title: Revenge Served Cold
quest.objective: find Kayleen's jade amulet that was stolen by goblins, and bring it back to Corrick Northwode
tasks: avenge Kayleen by killing the goblins that killed her
find Kayleen's jade amulet that was stolen by goblins, and bring it back to Corrick Northwode
quest.description:
Please... I implore you, help me, Corrick Northwode, avenge my wife's death!
Barely a week ago, I left Harm's Folly to go buy supplies as I usually do once a month. What a fool I was to leave my wife alone. The goblins must have been watching me, as they knew right when to strike. I could hear her screams from far away. Those wretched beasts killed her! Filthy animals! Had I only been there to stop them!
I'll tell you how you can help. Go to Exhausted Mine. Kill those goblins. Every last one of them! They destroyed everything I hold dear! In their greed, the creatures grabbed a jade amulet off of Kayleen's... body. Bring me back that amulet, so I may use it to remember her by.
Please, I'll give you six gems as a token of my gratitude. They're all I have left of value, but you must have them if you do the deed.

BG162: a female mage of minor power
BG165: a baby and Brielbara's only daughter

plots: Yago has cursed Namara: Brielbara can undo the curse with Yago's spellbook

quest.title: Brielbara's Baby
quest.objective: bring Yago's spellbook to Brielbara
quest.description:
Travelers! I am Brielbara, a mage of minor power.
I'll pay you 200 gold, not much for heroic adventurers, but all that I have.
An evil mage has laid a curse upon my only child, Namara. She is slowly wasting away and, without help, she'll die. The mage who did this is named Yago, and I'm sure that he possesses the remedy to the curse. Would you track him down for me, please? He's been staying at a place called the Low Lantern. It's the playground for the wicked and depraved, a ship where prostitutes ply their trade. All I want you to do is find him and take his spellbook. I have enough magical skill to reverse the curse if I had the formula for his spell.

BG263: leader of the troupe of bards and actors
BG265: a male actor in Raelis Shai's troupe

plots: Haer'Dalis is an actor in Raelis Shai's troupe
Haer'Dalis was captured by Mekrath because Mekrath coveted Haer'Dalis' gem

quest.title: Free Haer'Dalis from Inprisonment by Mekrath
quest.objective: return Haer'Dalis and his gem to the troupe
tasks: return Haer'Dalis and his gem to the troupe
quest.description:
I am Raelis Shai, the leader of this merry troupe.
The vagaries of fortune blow an ill wind over us. One of our members is absent due to circumstances we cannot control.
You must hear our story. One of our actors, Haer'Dalis, has been kidnapped by a wizard native to this city... he has made no effort to negotiate with us. The wizard's greed may have called to him at the sight of Haer'Dalis's beloved gem... something our sparrow would not gladly surrender. So this wizard has stolen both away, and there is nothing we can do. I would ask that you return our sparrow and his gem to us both, by whatever means possible.
The wizard's name is Mekrath, I believe... I know that his lair can be accessed through the city's sewers, though where exactly it lies is a mystery.
We are but a destitute troupe of players, child, and can afford little. Mekrath may have treasure of his own... Wrest it from his grasp if you wish to do so.

BG2227: a woman, and Shadowmaster of Eastern Esmeltaran
BG2231: a guildmaster of the Shadow Thieves

plots: the player is a Shadowmaster of the Shadow Thieves
Sir Greshal has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a Shadow Thieves' contact here in the city: that contact will be the player
Ama will dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal after the player meets her

quest.title: Government Relations
quest.objective: help Ama kill Sir Greshal
quest.description:
My name is Ama, and I am Shadowmaster of Eastern Esmeltaran.
I would like you to participate in a little rendezvous and help in the removal of a pest. There is a government official, Sir Greshal, causing us no end of trouble with his tariffs and spot checks on caravans. This fool thinks he can stifle the thieving trade of an entire city. He has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves, and while we could pay, it is better that we send a message to any of his cohorts. I have come here with a promise of granting his wishes, but I only want to lure him away from his palisade defenses. This is where you come in.
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a contact here in the city, and that contact will be you. The meeting is already set up, and when he arrives, we will take him by surprise. You are known somewhat in this place, if not as a guildmaster. He will believe you are a legitimate contact. He seems willing to believe anything, so long as it is theatrical.
It will be any evening that is best for you. I will await you in Waukeen's Promenade after dark and then dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal. The suddenness will seem dramatic to him.

BG135: to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn
BG137: to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn
to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn

plots: Unshey had to bargain her new Girdle of Piercing for her life

quest.title: A Rogue Ogre
quest.objective: bring the Girdle of Piercing to Unshey
tasks: kill the ogre holding the Girdle of Piercing
bring the Girdle of Piercing to Unshey
quest.description:
Hey, I'm Unshey, an aspiring writer.
Have you heard? There's a rogue ogre with a belt fetish to the south of the Friendly Arm Inn. I had to bargain my new girdle of piercing for my life out there. Wasn't even interested in an autographed copy of my book. Hey, if you can get that belt back to me, I'd be mighty grateful.
You'll get 95 gold pieces for your trouble, and a new history book I've just completed.

plots: Luke wants comfort
the player is a friend of Luke

quest.title: Sweet Dreams
quest.objective: give a green bed to Luke
tasks: give a green bed to Luke
quest.description:
I hate working the forge all day long. People should learn to make their tools themselves! Arrgh!
I'm sorry friend. I'm just feeling quite cranky at the moment. My bed is all lumpy and uncomfortable. If only I had a better bed. That would surely improve my mood!
Could you, perhaps, obtain a bed for me? I'd prefer a green bed. Help your friend get rest at night. I'd be even willing to part from 32 emeralds for a good bed.

plots: two Sturmbeorn blacksmiths are making suits of armor for Warbeasts

quest.title: The Warbeast Armory
quest.objective: steal the armor schematics
tasks: get inside the Sturmbeorn makeshift smithy
quest.description:
If you're going out to the Temple Steppes, I could use your help. The Sturmbeorn have set up a makeshift smithy there, and they have two blacksmiths making suits of armor for wild Warbeasts they've captured.
Those Sturmbeorn seem to be working from schematics, but they keep them under lock and key. Do you think you might be able to get in there and grab the armor schematics?

plots: wants equipment
glistering melon slices are used to brew healing potions

quest.title: A Helping Hand
quest.objective: bring glistering melon slices to Cleo
tasks: bring glistering melon slices to Cleo
quest.description:
I am a farmer here in Seaside Settlement. Sometimes, I get a bountiful harvest of melons. I process most of the melons into glistering melon slices for clerics and their important healing potions.
I actually just finished preparing some glistering melon slices. Could you please take them to the cleric in the village of Humming Hills? I'm sure she'll pay you for them.

plots: Quintus Navale has thought about repairing the White Phial
Nurelion was obsessed with the White Phial: his obsession consumed him

quest.title: Repairing the Phial
quest.objective: acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
tasks: Go to Throat of the World.
acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
quest.description:
I have some thoughts about repairing the White Phial. There are three crucial elements. Some may be easier to find than others.
On the top of the Throat of the World is a patch of unmelting snow. No heat can touch it. Then we need the tusk of a mammoth, ground to a fine powder as only the giants know how. The final step is tricky. It requires the briar heart from a Forsworn of the Reach.
If you can bring me these materials, the Phial can again be made whole. You can keep the White Phial after I have repaired it. I fear keeping the Phial would just remind me of Nurelion's obsession, and how it consumed him.

TESS68: a city with tall, yet old and crumbling walls

plots: Galmar Stone-Fist is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim
Imperial legionnaires have been stationed on the walls of Whiterun

quest.title: Storm over Whiterun
quest.objective: take Whiterun in the name of the Stormcloaks
tasks: tear through the barricades, and find a way to drop the drawbridge into Whiterun
take Whiterun in the name of the Stormcloaks
quest.description:
This is it men! They say that our cause is false and that we are nothing more than thieves, thugs and murderers! But no! We are farmers! We are craftsmen! We are sons and daughters of shopkeepers, maid servants and soldiers!
We are the sons and daughters of Skyrim! And we have come this far because our cause is true. Because we fight as one. And because our hearts are bursting with anger! What we do here today, we do for our country! For all the true Nords of Skyrim!
Whiterun's walls are tall, but they are old and crumbling, like the Empire whose Legion lines them. They've barricades to block us, but we'll tear through them and the Imperials behind them! Our objective is the drawbridge. If we can find a way to drop it, the city will be ours!
Everyone on me. Let's show these Imperial milk drinkers what true Nords look like! Rrrrraaaaaarrrrr!!!!!

TESS815: a hunter, and a worried brother
TESS816: Wulf Wild-Blood's brother, a wild man and a fearsome warrior

plots: Torkild may have become a werebear: a bear-like cursed creature

quest.title: Filial Bonds
quest.objective: find Torkild
tasks: see if Torkild is with the werebears of the glacier
quest.description:
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Torkild had a wild gleam in his eye, more than most. In my darkest times, I fear he fell in among the werebears of the glacier.
Werebears are twisted, cursed beasts. True bears are noble and great creatures of the wild. I've heard tell of men who, by curse or by heart's desire, become transformed into one of those vile things. It is a pitiable fate. And one that I fear has fallen to my brother.
If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.

plots: Farkas knows where the player might find the dragon

quest.title: Dragon Seekers
quest.objective: kill a dragon with Farkas
quest.description:
Travelers have been coming to Whiterun. They tell stories about dragons. I've heard of them, but didn't think they were real.
Rumors also claim that you have defeated dragons before. You are a very brave person worthy of being a Companion. But I already knew that.
Let's go kill a dragon together. That's one way to find out if they're real. I even know where we might find one. Lead on!

TESO144: Count Indarys' son, and a brash young man

plots: Farwil entered the Oblivion Gate with six other Knights of Thorn: Count Indarys posted guards around the Oblivion Gate
Farwil formed the Knights of the Thorn two years ago

quest.title: The Wayward Knight
quest.objective: save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
tasks: save Farwil from Oblivion, and close the Oblivion Gate
quest.description:
About two days ago, Count Indarys's son, Farwil, entered the Oblivion Gate with six other men. We haven't heard from them since then. The Count fears the worst, and has posted guards here so we can watch and see if anyone comes back out. So far, nothing.
At this point, Count Indarys is offering a reward for the recovery of his son from inside the gate... or confirmed news of his demise. If you find him or the rest of the Knights of the Thorn, get them out of there. I'm sure that the Count would also be pleased if the gate was closed.
The Knights of the Thorn are a bunch of rabble who fancy themselves true knights. Farwil formed the group around two years ago. They make grand boasts, and talk a good talk, but that's all they are. The real work goes to us, the City Guard. I hate to speak ill of them, as something horrible may have happened, but their own bravado got them into this mess.
